extendedIngredients.name: shrimp
extendedIngredients.original: 16 jumbo shrimp (about 2 pounds), shelled and deveined

extendedIngredients.name: red onion
extendedIngredients.original: 1 small red onion, sliced into rings

title: Pan-Roasted Shrimp with Orange, Arugula, and Tarragon
summary: Pan-Roasted Shrimp with Orange, Arugula, and Tarragon is a caveman, gluten free, dairy free, and primal recipe with 4 servings. This main course has 429 calories, 50g of protein, and 17g of fat per serving. For $6.08 per serving, this recipe covers 35% of your daily requirements of vitamins and minerals. 1 person found this recipe to be delicious and satisfying. From preparation to the plate, this recipe takes approximately 45 minutes. If you have white-wine vinegar, oranges, jumbo shrimp, and a few other ingredients on hand, you can make it. To use up the kosher salt you could follow this main course with the Low Fat Crumbs Cake (Kosher-Dairy) as a dessert. All things considered, we decided this recipe deserves a spoonacular score of 76%. This score is good. Similar recipes are Bruschetta with Shrimp, Tarragon and Arugula, Toasted Ciabatta with Shrimp, Tarragon and Arugula, and Fusilli with Shrimp, Orange and Arugula (Summer).

winePairing.pairingText: Pinot Grigio, Riesling, and Sauvignon Blanc are great choices for Shrimp. These crisp white wines work well with shrimp prepared in a variety of ways, whether grilled, fried, or in garlic sauce. You could try Chehalem 3 Vineyard Pinot Gris. Reviewers quite like it with a 4.4 out of 5 star rating and a price of about 26 dollars per bottle.

productMatches.title: Chehalem 3 Vineyard Pinot Gris
productMatches.description: A blend of three great vineyards, this vivid grape crafts a food-friendly wine, bright and pure. Gray it isn't. The knife-edged acid, with pear, lemon sorbet, spice and jasmine makes your mouth water and your hands shake.

instructions: Preheat the oven to 425. Finely grate the zest of 1 orange. Using a sharp knife, peel both oranges, removing all of the bitter white pith. Thinly slice the oranges crosswise; set aside. In a large bowl, toss the shrimp with 2 tablespoons of the olive oil, 1 tablespoon of the tarragon and the salt, pepper and garlic.                                              Heat a large ovenproof skillet. Add the shrimp in a single layer and cook over moderately high heat, stirring, for 1 minute. Remove the skillet from the heat.                                              Roast the shrimp in the oven for 2 minutes. Using tongs, turn the shrimp and add the orange juice and zest. Roast for another 1 to 2 minutes, or until the shrimp are opaque throughout.                                              Meanwhile, in a large bowl, whisk the vinegar into the remaining 2 tablespoons of oil. Whisk in the juices from the shrimp. Add the arugula and toss; transfer the salad to plates. Arrange the shrimp, oranges and onion on the salads, garnish with the remaining tarragon and serve.

steps.step: Finely grate the zest of 1 orange. Using a sharp knife, peel both oranges, removing all of the bitter white pith. Thinly slice the oranges crosswise; set aside. In a large bowl, toss the shrimp with 2 tablespoons of the olive oil, 1 tablespoon of the tarragon and the salt, pepper and garlic.
Add the shrimp in a single layer and cook over moderately high heat, stirring, for 1 minute.
Remove the skillet from the heat.
Roast the shrimp in the oven for 2 minutes. Using tongs, turn the shrimp and add the orange juice and zest. Roast for another 1 to 2 minutes, or until the shrimp are opaque throughout.
Meanwhile, in a large bowl, whisk the vinegar into the remaining 2 tablespoons of oil.
Whisk in the juices from the shrimp.
Add the arugula and toss; transfer the salad to plates. Arrange the shrimp, oranges and onion on the salads, garnish with the remaining tarragon and serve.
